titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Dudley Buck portraits V1997.023
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by John Zarrillo

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-10-21T16:23-0400

did.abstract: Two portraits of composer-organist Dudley Buck, circa 1900. Both portraits are mounted on board. One is autographed by Buck.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Dudley Buck portraits, V1997.023, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Immediate source of acquisition unknown. Accessioned in 1997.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Dudley Buck was born in Hartford, Connecticut, on March 19, 1839. He served as a church organist and touring concert organist for many years. In 1875, he moved to New York. Two years later, Buck assumed the position of organist/choirmaster at Brooklyn's Church of the Holy Trinity. In the same year, he began his tenure as founding director of the Brooklyn Apollo Club's male chorus. In 1898, Buck was honored by election to the National Institute of Arts and Letters. Eleven years later, on October 6, 1909, the composer died at the age of 70.
-- from the Library of Congress Performing Arts Encyclopedia

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Portraits are assumed to be in the public domain by 2021.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: BHS holds the following related collections:
Apollo Club of Brooklyn minute book (2000.016)
Church of the Holy Trinity collection (1986.025)
